result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas not in court.  Attorney Matt Last appeared by video for Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas.  Attorney Gerald Alder in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Michael R Staskunas.

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense filed a request to adjourn plea and sentencing on October 17, 2022.  Court grants adjournment and reschedules the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defense filed a request to adjourn plea and sentencing on October 17, 2022.  Court scheduled a status conference on October 6, 2022 at 1:30 PM to address this matter.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas in court, appeared in person with attorney Matt Last, appeared in person.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Hearing held. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF RECORD - Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas in court with attorney Matt Last.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense is requesting an additional status date. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matt Last in court, defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas not in court, in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas in court with attorney Matt Last, appear in person.  Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing.   SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas in court with attorney Colleen Cullen.  Defendant Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose M Hernaiz-Vargas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
